tweets.text:
Retire at 45 or die at your desk at 67. Your choice.

FIRE calculator: https://boring-math.com/calculators/fire-calculator

The pension age keeps rising. At this rate we'll all be working until we're dead.

Or you could do the maths: https://boring-math.com/calculators/fire-calculator

Financial independence = telling your boss to do one.

How far away is that glorious day?

https://boring-math.com/calculators/fire-calculator

Some people dream of retirement. I dream of not having to pretend I like my colleagues.

FIRE calculator: https://boring-math.com/calculators/fire-calculator

Your money could be making money while you sleep.

Instead it's sat in a current account earning 0.01% like a mug.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/compound-interest-calculator

Einstein called compound interest the 8th wonder of the world.

Your savings account calls it 'lol no.'

https://boring-math.com/calculators/compound-interest-calculator

£100/month for 30 years at 7% = £122,000

Or you could keep buying meal deals and see how that works out.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/compound-interest-calculator

Can you afford that house?

No. None of us can. But let's do the maths anyway.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/mortgage-calculator

The bank says you can afford a £400k mortgage.

The bank is lying to you.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/mortgage-calculator

Property ladder? More like property snake that eats your entire salary.

Mortgage calculator: https://boring-math.com/calculators/mortgage-calculator

Step 1: Fall in love with house
Step 2: Cry at the mortgage calculation
Step 3: Keep renting

https://boring-math.com/calculators/mortgage-calculator

Congrats on your £100k salary!

HMRC: *cracks knuckles* We'll be taking 60% of everything above that, cheers.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/uk-100k-tax-trap-calculator

Earn £100k-£125k in the UK and enjoy our special 60% tax rate.

Not a joke. Genuinely not a joke.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/uk-100k-tax-trap-calculator

The £100k tax trap: where working harder means keeping less.

Britain in a nutshell really.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/uk-100k-tax-trap-calculator

Got a bonus pushing you over £100k?

Shove it in your pension or HMRC gets 60p of every quid.

Sorry, I don't make the rules.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/uk-100k-tax-trap-calculator

Splitting the bill with mates shouldn't require a maths degree and a therapy session.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/tip-calculator

"I only had a salad" - person who definitely had three cocktails

Just use the calculator: https://boring-math.com/calculators/tip-calculator

The UK tipping discourse is exhausting. Here's a calculator. Tip or don't. I'm not your mum.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/tip-calculator

BMI was invented by a mathematician, not a doctor.

So it's about as useful as you'd expect.

But here you go: https://boring-math.com/calculators/bmi-calculator

According to BMI, most rugby players are obese.

Make of that what you will.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/bmi-calculator

How much paint do you need?

Not 'guess and make 3 trips to B&Q' - actual maths.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/paint-calculator

Nothing says 'weekend ruined' like running out of paint halfway up the wall.

Do the maths first: https://boring-math.com/calculators/paint-calculator

B&Q's paint calculator vs our paint calculator:

Theirs: Buy more paint
Ours: Actual maths

https://boring-math.com/calculators/paint-calculator

British BBQ planning:

1. Check weather (rain)
2. BBQ anyway
3. How much meat though?

https://boring-math.com/calculators/bbq-calculator

You will either have 47 leftover sausages or none.

There is no in between.

Unless you use maths: https://boring-math.com/calculators/bbq-calculator

Dad's BBQ estimation skills: 'Yeah that looks about right'

Narrator: It was not about right.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/bbq-calculator

Open bar at a British wedding is basically financial suicide.

At least know how much you're losing: https://boring-math.com/calculators/wedding-alcohol-calculator

Running out of booze at your wedding: disaster
Overcatering by 300%: expensive disaster

Pick your disaster wisely: https://boring-math.com/calculators/wedding-alcohol-calculator

Your nan drinks more than you think.

Wedding alcohol calculator: https://boring-math.com/calculators/wedding-alcohol-calculator

The spreadsheet says 3 drinks per person.

Your uncle Dave says hold my beer.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/wedding-alcohol-calculator

Going freelance to escape the 9-5.

Now working 24/7 for less money.

At least know what to charge: https://boring-math.com/calculators/freelance-day-rate-calculator

Client: 'What's your day rate?'
You: *guesses*
Client: 'Deal!'
You: 'Wait no-'

https://boring-math.com/calculators/freelance-day-rate-calculator

Your day rate needs to cover: tax, pension, holidays, sick days, the crippling loneliness...

https://boring-math.com/calculators/freelance-day-rate-calculator

Will you ever pay off your student loan?

Probably not, but let's check.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/uk-student-loan-calculator

Student loan: the debt you forget about until you get a payrise and SLC takes 9% of your joy.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/uk-student-loan-calculator

Plan 2 student loan: It's not really a loan, it's a 30-year graduate tax.

See the maths: https://boring-math.com/calculators/uk-student-loan-calculator

Good news: Your student loan gets written off after 30 years

Bad news: You'll be 51

https://boring-math.com/calculators/uk-student-loan-calculator

How much does a baby cost?

Your will to live, mostly. But also money.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/baby-cost-calculator

Childcare costs in the UK: Basically a second mortgage but it screams at you.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/baby-cost-calculator

Year 1 baby costs: nappies, formula, existential dread, nursery fees...

Actually do the maths: https://boring-math.com/calculators/baby-cost-calculator

Calories in < calories out.

Simple maths. Absolutely brutal execution.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/calorie-calculator

How many calories do you need?

More than you want. Less than you're eating.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/calorie-calculator

Snowball vs Avalanche debt payoff:

One feels good. One saves money.

Pick your fighter: https://boring-math.com/calculators/debt-payoff-calculator

How long until you're debt free?

Longer than you'd like. Let's see the damage: https://boring-math.com/calculators/debt-payoff-calculator

Debt is just borrowing happiness from your future self.

Here's how much you owe future-you: https://boring-math.com/calculators/debt-payoff-calculator

Is your side hustle actually profitable?

After costs, time, and tears?

Probably not: https://boring-math.com/calculators/side-hustle-calculator

Passive income!

*requires 60 hours of active work per week*

Do the real maths: https://boring-math.com/calculators/side-hustle-calculator

Your Etsy shop hourly rate after supplies, fees, shipping, and 47 hours of 'marketing':

£2.30

https://boring-math.com/calculators/side-hustle-calculator

'Renting is throwing money away!'

So is stamp duty, maintenance, and the inevitable leak.

Do the maths: https://boring-math.com/calculators/buy-vs-rent-calculator

Buy vs rent?

Both options feel like losing tbh.

See which loses less: https://boring-math.com/calculators/buy-vs-rent-calculator

How much emergency fund do you need?

3 months if you're lucky. 12 months if you've met the job market.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/emergency-fund-calculator

Emergency fund: For when life says 'boiler's broken, car's dead, and your job's gone. Good luck!'

https://boring-math.com/calculators/emergency-fund-calculator

What's £100 worth in 20 years?

About £60 in today's money.

Inflation: the silent killer of savings.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/inflation-calculator

Remember when a Freddo was 10p?

Inflation calculator: https://boring-math.com/calculators/inflation-calculator

Assets minus liabilities.

Your salary means nothing. This number is what matters.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/net-worth-calculator

Net worth check:

House value - Mortgage - Credit cards - Student loan - Existential dread

= ???

https://boring-math.com/calculators/net-worth-calculator

£10k savings goal = £27/day.

Or £833/month.

Or one fewer coffee and you'll get there in 47 years.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/savings-goal-calculator

Big savings goal? Break it into small, depressing daily targets.

Somehow that helps: https://boring-math.com/calculators/savings-goal-calculator

Stamp duty: The government's 'congrats on buying a house, now pay us £15k' tax.

https://boring-math.com/calculators/uk-stamp-duty-calculator

First time buyer stamp duty relief:

'Here's a tiny discount on your impossible dream.'

https://boring-math.com/calculators/uk-stamp-duty-calculator
